medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was initially taken to the hospital for treatment of seizures at the age of 3. Prior to this, he had developed normally. Following the onset of seizures, he experienced progressive cognitive disorder, neuromotor dysfunction, and vision problems. An unsteady gait was observed at the age of 3-4 years, which progressed to increasing difficulties in walking, talking, and swallowing. The patient's condition deteriorated over time, leading to loss of sight and ability to stand and vocalize, ultimately resulting in death at the age of 8.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Unremarkable antenatal and perinatal history; developed normally until seizures appeared at age 3.
medical_history.family_history: Born to healthy parents with an unremarkable family history.
